message: DofMap can report if it is capable of using blocked storage
extend blocksize option to matrices init()ed without the help of the DofMap
Switch some cout/cerr uses to libMesh::out/err
Not every node of "this_mesh" needs to be stitched.
Need to do one final comparison for fuzzy_binary_find.
Adding version of Utility::binary_find() that takes a custom comparison object.
Use TOLERANCE while sorting the points  this tolerance is independent of the point matching tolerance asked for by the user.
Switching to relative tolerance check (relative to the smallest edge length on the surfaces being stitched) in stitch_meshes().
nevermind  leaving this file will help if some platform requires preprocessor macros for openMP workarounds.  unlikely  but better safe.
fix unnecessary comma causing issue for some compilers
I cover with pgi-13.4 now too.
petsc-3.4: VecType  PCType  and KSPType are now const typedefs
Got copy of Satou paper  they do use Libmesh.
Boyce Griffith says these papers don't use libmesh :-(
Adding Hu et al tech report.
Remove equivalence between "SHELL" and standard element types.
need to use ilu with BAIJ format
avoid preallocation error that seems to be triggered by blocked matrix storage
avoid preallocation error that seems to be triggered by blocked matrix storage
BAIJ API seqence for v3.2 & below appears different - disable feature rather than figure this out.
If we want to force the user to be responsible for parallel consistency (which Roy does - not sure I'm sold) at least we should give them a public member to make it easy.
More fixes for dof_id_type != unsigned int
Fix signed/unsigned warning in debug mode.
Added miscellaneous_ex9: Example that demonstrates a discontinuity on an internal mesh interface  which requires the sparsity pattern to be augmented.
Rb stuff needs a non-const reference to dof_indices.
Update solvers to use updated FEMContext API.
Need non-const versions of these accessors. I'm not convinced this is the right way to go here  but rolling with it for now.
Updating reduced_basis to use new FEMContext API's.
Assert on the private data structures.
Update to use new FEMContext API. Also needed a non-const Elem&.
Return a reference to the QBase instead of a pointer.
Now make everything protected/private. The library builds for me  but the examples still need to be updated so likely make check will fail at this point.
Updated adjoints_ex1 to use the new FEMContext API.
Update adjoint_ex2 for new FEMContext API.
Update adjoints_ex3 to use new FEMContext API.

Updated adjoints_ex5 to use updated FEMContext API.
Updated fem_system examples to use updated FEMContext API.
Commit the usage statistics PDFs  not everyone has Matlab/Octave easily accessible.
Adding all Moose talks from M&C2013.
Updated reduced_basis examples to conform to new FEMContext API.
UPdated vector_fe examples to conform to new FEMContext API.
Reduced Basis change: Added new assembly classes that contain references to RBConstruction objects. These references are often needed in practice  e.g. to access the mesh.
Removed RBEIMAssemblyWithConstruction  since we can actually get the info we need (e.g. boundary ids) from the FEMContext in most cases

Removed RBEIMAssemblyWithConstruction  since we can actually get the info we need (e.g. boundary ids) from the FEMContext in most cases. Also removed elem_assembly_with_construction.h for the same reason.
Added DGFEMContext. Extends FEMContext to enable assembly of DG terms.
Some RB changes related to DGFEMContext  and the changes to Makefile.in etc as well
Reduced basis updates related to DGFEMContext. Use a DGFEMContext instead of FEMContext for increased generality.
be silent when generating .depend  and remove .lo files for clean
prepping release files  and updated automation script
Added libmesh_experimental() in the DGFEMContext constructor.
Fix broken libtool script with install-data-hook commands.

Reduced Basis change: Removed singe_matrix_mode. The purpose of this mode was to provide a low-memory version  which re-assembled matrices rather than storing them. But it wasn't used and therefore wasn't well tested  and it complicated the code for little benefit. If this functionality is desired in the future  better to put it in a subclass.
Patch from @dknez to fixed reduced_basis_ex2 for FEMContext API updated.
Patch from @dknez to fix reduced_basis_ex7 for FEMContext API changes.
Revert "Now make everything protected/private. The library builds for me "
Adding Kirk AIAA  Corsini JFE  Widmer JMBBM  and Tahir Acta Materialia papers.
Confirmed Corsini paper does use libmesh.
